this is a region in the Middle East in the GCC that has a tech-savvy population
internet penetration rates are amongst the highest in the world mobile penetration rates are over a hundred and

that there's initiative there's entrepreneurship you make do with less resources you challenge bigger
competitors and as I look back at that that's true about Amazon because they've
built a retail retailing business that challenged the likes of Walmart they've
built a cloud business that now is amongst the largest in the world and it is true of this
island of behind that historically has developed leading thinking around
regulation historically and I only look at one example that in 2005 based on the
vision of His Majesty and His Royal Highness the crown prince we opened up
our telecom sector and open it up to competition we allowed competition to
enter to compete with our domestic operator our incumbent we moved from one
Operator to 20 operators and the results were astounding we saw 70% growth in
that sector we saw broadband prices drop by about 70% we saw mobile prices dropped by 40%
the consumer benefited the customer benefited the industry benefited and the
country benefited now we want to have that same forward-thinking regulatory
approach today just in the financial sector alone in the last few months the
central bank of Bahrain has introduced the first onshore regulatory sandbox in the entire region it was followed just
recently by crowdfunding equity and debt crowdfunding regulation to allow
businesses to have access to finance and you'll hear later from my colleague in Hamad Al Hadid who heads the government
in the government of Bahrain about what the government is doing as it leads to move to the cloud now we are determined

the next few months we want to introduce data privacy laws data sovereignty laws
we do this because we believe in the potential of the region we believe that

one of the primary reasons so the ability to try things and fail fast that
experimentation that you need when you're utilizing technology because in
the old world you spent a lot of money actually trying things you had to go by

cost savings so you have agility cost savings elasticity the ability to absorb
innovation on demand and then in addition to that you have the ability to

there's there's lots more to that but those are the basic fundamentals that we always talk about again lots of cost

talk to you just a second about Amazon's approach to innovation we always begin
